poem:
### Transatlantic Murmurs

In Brussels, the air hums with concern,  
a delicate dance of whispers, tariffs  
as chess pieces on a looming board.  
Trump at the helm, Stoltenberg leans in,  
a gentle murmur of diplomacy,  
like leaves rustling in a European breeze—  
a conversation across an ocean,  
a finger tracing the lines of a map.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘We will protect our interests, however and whenever needed’: EU’s von der Leyen responds to Trump tariff threats - Europe live 1.30pm GMT We need to talk, 'Trump-whisperer' Stoltenberg says Former Nato chief Jens Stoltenberg, who became Norway’s new finance minister on Tuesday, said engaging with the Trump administration on trade was key to avoiding tariffs as Europe braces for a potential transatlantic trade war, Reuters reports. The appointment of the widely respected veteran politician". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
